Description: Rim sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus-palmette in added white outline with added red centres; exterior: short vertical strokes at rim; below, maeander running left between pairs of bands; below, traces of filling ornaments. One very large chalk inclusion in clay.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1924,1201.484. The decoration on British Museum 1924,1201.484, consisting of a metopal decoration in the form of the large maeander, is typical of the Wild Goat Style. However, the presence of interior decoration, which is not found on Wild Goat Style vases, suggests that the sherd is possibly late in that style and marks the transition to the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 260, no. 515)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0383) (phase 2)
